data.title: Best. sit Down Breakfast in Palatine
data.text:
My husband and I come here at least once a month.  The meals are tasty and service is good.  

The one downside is depending on the time of day, meals can take longer to make.

Service staff is top notch.

data.title: Delicious food!
data.text: Very cozy place, food was delicious, service was good, it could be better, but overall everything was good. I would definitely come back

data.title: Good food but poor service
data.text:
I've given up on Bread and Butter.  When they first opened I was willing to give them so slack on the poor service - they had just opened and it seemed to perhaps be a family run restaurant. I thought perhaps they needed some 'learning time'.  The food was good and a pretty good value for the money.

But I was there again this past weekend and they just can't seem to get the service part of running a restaurant right.  The busboy seemed to be doing all the work.  But our waiter was MIA.  When we were ready to leave we saw him leaning back behind the counter just chatting with people.  I finally had to go up to the register to get our check (which was already totaled up BTW).

data.title: Dog friendly breakfast spot
data.text:
We had a house showing this morning so we decided to go out and have breakfast at the bread-and-butter Café, since we had not been there before.

It was such a nice day we decided to eat on the patio and were told that our dog could come and sit with us. It's very nice to have a dog friendly restaurant for breakfast.

We all ordered something different and the food was excellent and I like the choice of  fruit instead of fried breakfast potatoes or hashbrowns. The menu had a little bit of everything for breakfast and they had weekend specials for breakfast.

I would recommend eating at this café with your dog on the patio is a relaxing experience in a very pleasant time to spend eating and enjoying time with your dog at the same time.

Great new breakfast restaurants in town. Try it and you will like it

data.title: Bad service and food
data.text:
Went to the Bread and Butter restaurant in Palatine to see if it was as good as Grammy D's.
The young kid who took our order got the drink order wrong after we waited 10 minutes for our drinks. We ordered our soup and sandwiches and waited another 10 minutes for our soup to come  which was warm. When my Turkey Club arrived it was soggy and the turkey was slimy.
Other people were waiting a long time just to be served. I found it to be unorganized and the staff not knowing how to run things in a small restaurant. The service was slow and I would definitely not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

data.title: Now Open and Great
data.text: Where Grammy D's used to be Bread and Butter now is and it is wonderful.  The coffee is excellent, the food is excellent, and the wait staff is excellent.  It's nice to find a cozy place where it's quiet and you aren't competing with the music or kitchen noises; and where the wait staff is attentive and you are served in a timely manner but you don't feel rushed.  The restaurant sign is lost in a sea of signage along Northwest Highway but it's between the chain roast beef restaurant and the bike shop and worth a turn around if you missed the turn in if you are looking for a great meal.
